comment: I love this professor! He was super funny and made me want to come to class. The assignments were spaced out enough to be able to complete each one on time. The instructions were super clear. We got 3 major assignments plus a couple additional assignments that were super fun to complete. (I like writing, but he will make you enjoy it as well!)

Assignments were discussion posts, textbook work, group presentation, and an essay. Attendance is super important. Don't miss a single class. He was super funny & loves an interactive class. (the more interactive the better). He responded to emails quick as well. Definitely take him if you have the option too!

He was really cool, he likes a class who interacts with him. There's one group project and essay which are both really easy to complete. If you  make sure to complete the quizzes, and discussions you'll do fine and get a good grade. Over all his class was really fun and you'll want to show up to every class because he makes it a fun environment

He was a drama queen but he was good. He was good about due dates. The only thing that messed up this class was the Pearson homework but it's fine. Most of the class revolved around assignments related to your research paper and discussion questions. There was a group project at the end. Overall, pretty great professor.

I loved prof. Phill. He was super funny, and his class was relatively easy. Grade is based mostly on the final research paper, textbook assignments, and group project. My only complaint would be that due dates were somewhat unclear and the time spent in class had no relation to the work due. This is a relatively easy class & the professor is cool.

Professor Harrold is AMAZING! Attendant mandatory if you want to keep up with some degree of assignments and the group project. Textbook assignments 10%, group project 10%, research paper 30%. My only regret is only having one day physical class (hybrid course). Meaningful discussions and writings. Don't forget to pray for the Lyons to Win lol.

Professor Harrold is AMAZING. Critical Thinking, Reading, and Composing. Attendance is required if you want to keep up with some degree of assignments and a group project. Library Michelle Lee and Writing Center resources are amazing! Textbook 10% fg. Group Presentation 10% fg, Research Project 30% fg. No Midterm No final. Pray for the Lyons Wins!
Is a very fun class. Not too heavy on the work load. Really just have to talk in front of class twice.

Super chill. Literally, just show up and he'll be great to work with. Sends cryptic emails sometimes at odd hours so there's that. 

I sent in a paper and he said "I gave it a 100% because it was one of 2 that didn't make me viscerally angry."

Fun class! You only talk in front of the class twice. 1.Introduce yourself to the class.  2. Presenting your group project. End of the year group project is easy, just research a topic, make a PowerPoint, and present info. Professor is very lenient and caring. Just do the work. Pick your group wisely you'll be paired with them the whole semester.

Harrold is probably my favorite professor. I registered for his class at the last minute and I do not regret it. His work isn't too difficult, there is a weekly discussion post and he is really a funny guy. There are papers and major assignments to work on and you do have to talk in front of the class and work in groups, but its nothing hard.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Take him if you want an easy A. The only way to fail his class is not turning in any of the work. There is a weekly discussion post and assignment. (very easy!) He does make you do group projects and present in front of the class but he makes you feel comfortable. Also, there isn't a lot of essays! there's only one big one due at the end.

I was nervous to take this class because of how many people said we'd have to talk a lot. You do not have to speak in front of the class THAT much.  He is super funny, very blunt, and overall a great teacher. His assignments are interesting and easy. I recommend this class to all!

Mr. P or Master P is my favorite professor ever. He is extremely funny and supportive of you as a student. Very easy to make a friend of him and if you support or even act like you support the Detroit Lions, you'll get an easy A. Buy the book because the quizzes are copied down from the book (literally). Overall, 100% take him if you can.

I did not like him. Workload was not a lot but due dates were very unclear and instructions are not repeated if you miss class. I got an A grades easy and forces you to talk in front of the class 24/7. Didnt buy the textbook
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Harrold seemed like a good guy, his teaching style just wasn't for me. I felt like most of his assignments were unnecessary and did not benefit me at all. If you do not like speaking in front of the class or things like that DO NOT take him. He was also very unclear about due dates and homework assignments.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Overall he was not a TERRIBLE professor, I got an A on everything even when I did not put full effort into my assignment. I had him once a week so attendance was mandatory. He does not give very clear deadlines and instructions so you will need to keep asking him for clarification. He allows for the classes to be student lead most of the time.

Professor Harrold is a really nice guy. The topic of the entire course is of the supernatural, so if that is down your alley, you will enjoy this class. You get to pick your own topic for all of the bigger writing assignments. There are weekly discussion posts but they are very easy, just read his rubric so you get a good grade on your responses.
Absolutely amazing. He made everything clear from the beginning. Make sure you take him and just do what he says. Guaranteed A! 10/10!
Prof. Harrold is a nice professor. We were only graded by short discussion posts and 3 papers. We only used the textbook once. He clearly cares about his students. Take this class if you can.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Harrold is a great professor and really is passionate about his work. DO NOT SKIP CLASS! You most likely will not do good if you do because of his pop quizzes. Also, make sure you watch the videos if he posts them on D2L because quiz. He will him you become a better writer a guide you well. Very nice professor and is probably the best for english.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: he is the best english professor! he makes class fun and gives good tips to become better writers and he is not a tough grader

Master PhiLL was the best! I took his class hybrid and it was so enjoyable. We only had our research paper draft and final paper graded. Everything else was based on a 100 if we did it with effort, 70 just done, 0 if you didn't do it. I would love to take it again. He has no filter but it's funny.

The most awesome English professor Ive ever had in my life!!! I love Master Phill! We mainly watched a lot a videos or worked on an essay. He has no filter but thats what makes the class funny and comfortable. Didnt use the textbook at all. He has a couple of essays, a midterm, and a final, but youll pass his class, youll enjoy him!

Phill is a funny professor. He does not have a filter, but sometimes it was appreciated. I never really put in hard work, because there are no tests or quizzes, just easy papers and occasional discussion posts. We watched videos most of the time and if we weren't doing that, we worked on papers in class. We only did very few papers. Recommend 100%.

I took this class as a hybrid. There is a good amount of work, but nothing the average person couldn't handle. No reading required, no tests/quizzes, just writing. He is very funny, we watched a lot of videos and listened to music. Do the work, and you'll pass. I haven't failed anything in his class. I definitely recommend him and take him again.
Professor Harrold is a very chill professor. He makes every assignment very interesting and he cares about his students. I recommend taking him.
He is so funny! Gives lots of busy work and is an easy A. Honestly has no filter but he makes the class fun and comfortable right off the bat.

I loved master PhiLL. At the beginning of Class he might seem a little weird but give him a shot! Hes only hilarious. He has no filter & his honesty is so appreciated. I got an A on every paper just by simply going to the writing center to revise every paper!! I wish I could take him again . Very easy A. Do not get the book tho . He didnt use it
the easiest class ever! I got a 100 in everything I turned in. didnt really try hard in that class but as long as you show up you'll make an A. he's hilarious and he cancels class a lot
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Would take again

comment: He is a easy A. If you do it he will give you a 100. If you turn stuff in late the lowest he will give you is an 80. Dont ask about you grade or how your doing because he will make sure you pass. Honestly the easiest class youll take at Kennesaw
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Would take again

comment: I took his class as a hybrid. He is very open minded. The first three months of the semester he gave everyone 100's. He only grades your last two papers. He appreciates honesty. If you turn in something late, don't email him. He will most likely not notice and give you a 100 anyways.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Him and his family are veterans so much respect from me. He also cancels class a lot.
Do everything he tells you to and you'll make an A. This class was great. I enjoyed Master Phill's teaching style and the general vibe of his class. Just do EVERYTHING he says and it's an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Amazing teacher, if you can get him I would. He requires some participation ( Requires you to write a paragraph a week on d2l about a topic before class ), but otherwise expect papers about the legitimacy of Southpark and other actually interesting topics

I took him for ENGL 1102 Hybrid course. He's really nice and cares for his student a lot. If you can write well then it should be an easy A. There's a couple essays, a midterm, and a final. The essays are less than a thousand words and the midterm is not hard. I did not open the books at all this semester.  You would be writing a bit on D2l.
